thread.title: Moravian Academy field hockey team downs Southern Lehigh in Colonial League title game
thread.title_full: Moravian Academy field hockey team downs Southern Lehigh in Colonial League title game

title: Moravian Academy field hockey team downs Southern Lehigh in Colonial League title game
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Moravian Academy 3, Southern Lehigh 0 -- Rapid recap 
The Moravian Academy field hockey team captured its second straight Colonial League championship with a 3-0 victory over Southern Lehigh on Wednesday night at Salisbury High School. 
Turning point : Sophomore forward Ashley Pearce scored to break a scoreless tie with 20:55 left in the game. The big play took a lot of the pressure off the favored Lions and they were able to gain control from there. 
Top performer : Junior forward Mayv Clune assisted on Pearce's goal and then scored on a powerful backhand to give the Lions a 2-0 lead with 12:35 left. 
What it means : Southern Lehigh gave Moravian a great battle for 40 minutes but the Lions have so much strength and balance across the field and are tough to match up with. Moravian will be favored to win the District 11 Class AA Tournament, although Southern Lehigh may still have something to say about that down the road. 
Tom Hinkel may be reached at thinkel@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @TomHinkelLV . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook
